project.name: SELinux
project.description: This project manages the integration of SELinux in Gentoo.
project.longdescription: This project manages SELinux support in Gentoo. This includes providing kernels with SELinux support, providing patches to userland utilities, writing stong Gentoo-specific default profiles, and deploying policies from Portage.
project.goals: The intention of the project is to make SELinux available to more users. Policy should be available for common daemons, and files merged in from Portage should have the correct file context. Currently we only work on servers, but desktops may be supported in the future.

body.p: Security-Enhanced Linux (SELinux) is a system of mandatory access control using type enforcement and role-based access control. It is implemented as a Linux Security Module (LSM). The team currently supports the 2.4 version, which is only available on x86. The next kernel version, 2.6, will have SELinux and LSM included, and should work across most architectures. The SELinux team will be supporting more architectures, such as PPC with 2.6. In addition to the security module, SELinux consists of a library (libselinux) and userland utilities for compiling policy (checkpolicy), and loading policy (policycoreutils), in addition to other user programs.
